title: Poster, "Citicorp Center 7 - Arts & Crafts Exhibit", 1975
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed: Imprinted in gray lower right center: Citicorp Center is planning a / series of cultural events and / activities, in collaboration / with St. Peter's Church and / other institutions, for the / pleasure of the New York / City public. These events will / take place in the atrium, in / the church theater and, in / warm weather, on the plaza.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: Black and white photographic reproductions of isolated objects or individuals that evoke various artistic. Pictured are: [clockwise]A woman's high heeled sandal, a gossamer scarf, two dancers in leotards, a man's are in an elaborate ruffled costume with his hand pointing upward, a carved wooden frame with a basket and a ceramic pitcher. These all surround a clarinet that extends vertically through the center of the sheet. Red and white banded borders at upper and lower edges.. In red at lower right center in large block letters: CITICORP / CENTER and a block of text in gray.At lower left on edge in gray the number 7. Also in gray are captions for each image: Fashion Shows / Dance / Theater / Arts and Craafts / Exhibitions / Music.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Citicorp Center 7 - Arts & Crafts Exhibit", 1975.
1975. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-157.
